intro: Anzybas unguiculatus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Anzybas unguiculatus is popular in horticulture for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
